title: Imagine
song:
Imagine there's no heaven
It's easy if you try
No hell below us
Above us, only sky
Imagine all the people
Livin' for today

Imagine there's no countries
It isn't hard to do
Nothing to kill or die for
And no religion, too
Imagine all the people
Livin' life in peace

You may say I'm a dreamer
But I'm not the only one
I hope someday you'll join us
And the world will be as one

Imagine no possessions
I wonder if you can
No need for greed or hunger
A brotherhood of man
Imagine all the people
Sharing all the world

You may say I'm a dreamer
But I'm not the only one
I hope someday you'll join us
And the world will live as one
text:
Imagine there's no heaven
It's easy if you try
No hell below us
Above us, only sky
Imagine all the people
Livin' for today
explanation: Try to picture a world without the concept of an afterlife. It's not too difficult if you put your mind to it. There wouldn't be a place of eternal punishment beneath us, just endless sky above. Think of all the individuals focusing on enjoying the present moment instead of worrying about the afterlife.

text:
Imagine there's no countries
It isn't hard to do
Nothing to kill or die for
And no religion, too
Imagine all the people
Livin' life in peace
explanation: The speaker urges us to imagine a world without borders, one where there is no need for violence or sacrifice in the name of nationalism or religion. In this world, people can live in harmony and peace, free from the constraints of division and hate. This vision of a united humanity is a powerful message of hope and a call to action for all those who seek to create a better world for generations to come.

explanation: The speaker is expressing their hopeful vision for a united world, acknowledging that they may be seen as an idealist but asserting that they are not alone in their desires. They invite others to join them in working towards this goal, with the belief that one day their dream of a harmonious world can be realized.

explanation: The speaker acknowledges that they may be seen as a person who dreams or has unrealistic ideas. However, they believe they are not alone in this way of thinking and hope that others will also share their vision of a harmonious world. In this world, everyone would coexist peacefully regardless of their differences, and the speaker encourages others to join them in their pursuit of this ideal.

title: In the end
song:
It starts with one thing
I don't know why
It doesn't even matter how hard you try
Keep that in mind
I designed this rhyme
To explain in due time
All I know
Time is a valuable thing
Watch it fly by as the pendulum swings
Watch it count down to the end of the day
The clock ticks life away

It's so unreal
Didn't look out below
Watch the time go right out the window
Trying to hold on, didn't even know
I wasted it all just to watch you go
I kept everything inside
And even though I tried, it all fell apart
What it meant to me
Will eventually be a memory of a time when

I tried so hard
And got so far
But in the end
It doesn't even matter
I had to fall
To lose it all
But in the end
It doesn't even matter

One thing, I don't know why
It doesn't even matter how hard you try
Keep that in mind
I designed this rhyme
To remind myself how
I tried so hard
In spite of the way you were mocking me
Acting like I was part of your property
Remembering all the times you fought with me
I'm surprised it got so
Things aren't the way they were before
You wouldn't even recognize me anymore
Not that you knew me back then
But it all comes back to me in the end
You kept everything inside
And even though I tried, it all fell apart
What it meant to me will eventually be a memory of a time when

I tried so hard
And got so far
But in the end
It doesn't even matter
I had to fall
To lose it all
But in the end
It doesn't even matter

I've put my trust in you
Pushed as far as I can go
For all this
There's only one thing you should know
I've put my trust in you
Pushed as far as I can go
For all this
There's only one thing you should know

I tried so hard
And got so far
But in the end
It doesn't even matter
I had to fall
To lose it all
But in the end
It doesn't even matter
text:
It starts with one thing
I don't know why
It doesn't even matter how hard you try
Keep that in mind
I designed this rhyme
To explain in due time
All I know
Time is a valuable thing
Watch it fly by as the pendulum swings
Watch it count down to the end of the day
The clock ticks life away
explanation: The speaker begins by noting that something has happened, but they are unsure why. They acknowledge that no matter how much effort one puts in, it may not change the outcome. The purpose of their words is to clarify the situation at a later time. The speaker emphasizes the importance of time, noting how quickly it passes and how it marks the end of each day. They use the metaphor of a pendulum to represent the passage of time, and conclude with the sobering observation that life is ticking away.

explanation: I couldn't believe what was happening. I didn't see it coming and before I knew it, time had slipped away. I desperately tried to cling on, but it was all in vain. In the end, I lost everything just to see you leave. I kept my feelings bottled up, but despite my efforts, everything fell apart. What we had will only be remembered as a memory of a time when things were different.

explanation: I struggled to succeed despite the mocking and belittling from others. This rhyme was created to remind me of my efforts and determination, even in the face of adversity. The memories of those who fought against me have faded, and I've grown into a different person. However, the pain of my failed attempts still lingers, and I realize that it will only be a memory of a time when I tried so hard. Despite my best efforts, everything fell apart, and I couldn't keep it together.
